infotexts.talentdescription.fadedpatience: On hit with the Priest or Prayers staves, consume [amount2] Bloodfeast to gain [amount] Bloodied Hand, improving attack and defense capabilities based on its stack, up to [amount2] stacks. If you do not have enough Bloodfeast, apply [amount3] Bleeding to self and gain [amount] Bloodied Hand.
infotexts.talentdescription.dontcutmeoff: On hit with a Priest or Prayers staff, roll a [chance]% chance to gain [amount] Coagulated Blood and Bloodied Hand.
infotexts.talentdescription.endlessatonement: Upon activating Endless Atonement or Unforgivable Sin, convert all Bloodied Hand and Coagulated Blood into Offense and Defense Up and heal some physical damage and bloodloss.
infotexts.talentdescription.unforgivablesin: Additionally, gain [amount]% more radius and damage to all AoE and explosive abilities or weapons for [seconds] seconds after activating Endless Atonement or Unforgivable Sin.
infotexts.talentdescription.letsdressup: On hit with Fashionista or Barber Scissors, roll a [chance]% chance to gain [amount] Coagulated Blood and Blood-Tinged Scissorblades.
infotexts.talentdescription.weveaneventforyou: On hit with the Fashionista or Barber scissors, consume [amount2] Bloodfeast to gain [amount] Blood-Tinged Scissorblades, improving attack capabilities based on its stack, up to [amount2] stacks. If you do not have enough Bloodfeast, apply [amount3] Bleeding to self and gain [amount] Blood-Tinged Scissorblades.
infotexts.talentdescription.dontrushme: At max Blood-Tinged Scissorblades, aim the Fashionista or Barber Scissors for [seconds] seconds without attacking to gain [amount] stacks of Don't Rush Me. While active, deal up to [maxamount1]% more damage and attack up to [maxamount2]% faster with scissors based on stacks of Coagulated blood and Blood-Tinged Scissorblades. Consume all Blood-Tinged Scissorblades and Coagulated Blood when stacks are depleted.
infotexts.talentname.illmakeyouanewdress: I'll make you a new dress!
infotexts.talentdescription.enoughisenough: On hit with a Bloodfiend weapon, consume [amount2] Bloodfeast to gain [amount] Hardblood, boosting all stats. When using the Priest staff, inflict [amount3] Bleeding on self and gain [amount2] Bloodfeast instead.
infotexts.talentdescription.letallblossomfree: On hit with a Bloodfiend weapon, if the enemy has [chance] or more Bleeding, gain [amount] Hardblood.
infotexts.talentdescription.lasangre_newdress: Aim the Fashionista or Barber Scissors for [seconds] seconds without attacking to consume [hardblood] Hardblood and gain [amount] stacks of Split Apart. While active, attacks with Fashionista or Barber Scissors deal [maxamount]% more damage. (Cannot stack)
infotexts.talentdescription.lasangre_unforgivables: Upon activating Endless Atonement or Unforgivable Sin, consume [hardblood] Hardblood to gain Whip for [seconds], granting damage and bleed regeneration as well as [amount]% increased melee damage and attack speed as well as [amount]% increased explosion radius and damage. (Cannot stack)
infotexts.talentdescription.lasangre: Deal up to [lasangre]% more damage with the Manager's Lance based on Hardblood stacks. Inflict [amount]% more Bleeding. On kill, gain [bloodfeast] Bloodfeast and [hardblood] Hardblood.
infotexts.talentdescription.marchconductor: On hit with the Hardblood Glaive, consume [bloodfeast] Bloodfeast to gain [amount] Hardblood Armor.
infotexts.talentdescription.responsibilitytorebuil: Hits with the Hardblood Glaive give nearby allies [amount] Hardblood Armor. (Max 1 per second, does not apply to self). Additionally, apply Parade to the target for [seconds] seconds, making them take [parade]% more damage and deal [parade]% less damage to Bloodfiends.
infotexts.talentdescription.overture: Gain [amount] Bloodfeast on kill. Gain [hardbloodarmor] Hardblood Armor on kill with a [second] second cooldown.. Upon using Overture, convert all Hardblood Armor into Focused Performance, increasing your damage, defense, and regeneration temporarily.
infotexts.talentdescription.fearofwater: While on land, you cannot suffocate and take [amount]% less physical and bloodloss damage.
infotexts.talentdescription.thirstforblood: Gain immunity to husk infection, but going too long without attacking another living being or using a blood pack will slowly wither you away.
infotexts.talentdescription.sharedcooldown: This effect shares a cooldown with [talentname].
infotexts.talentdescription.abno_parry: Unlocks the knowledge of how to parry. Raising any melee weapon grants a brief window which allows you to parry incoming attacks. Parrying has a univeral cooldown of one second, however, highly skilled swordsmen can parry multiple attacks in quick succession. Continuing to hold your weapon up will slow you down, but will also allow you to guard against incoming attacks, reducing damage.
infotexts.talentdescription.servantofheaven: Whenever you apply medicine or use a melee weapon on a target, give them Heaven's Thorn.
infotexts.abnormalities.abnowork: Perform specialized interactions with the Abnormality to generate Enkephalin. Repeatedly press the "Work" key (at least once per 3 seconds) to continue the Work Process.
infotexts.abnormalities.dementonitespike: Dementonite is used to produce larger quantities of Enkephalin.
infotexts.talentdescription.egogifts: This talent facilitates the complex functions of different E.G.O. Gifts.
infotexts.talentdescription.poise: On hit, you have a chance to Critically Hit equal to [amount]*Poise. (Registered in increments of 5.) Critical Hits deal [critdmg]% more damage and reduce your Poise by 1.
infotexts.egogiftresearchstation.empty.infotext: No E.G.O. detected. Insert an E.G.O. Fragment or Gift.
infotexts.egogiftresearchstation.refine.infotext: Enkephalin detected. Ready to refine E.G.O. Gift.
infotexts.bolus.infotext: Bolus ingredient detected. Ready to process.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.enkephalinstart: Includes a cargo shipment of Enkephalin and a Processor
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.enkephalinestab: Includes an additional cargo shipment of Enkephalin, a Black Gate, and a Containment Cell
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.enkephalinfacto: Includes an additional cargo shipment of Enkephalin, an EGO Gift Research Station, and an Enkephalin Generator
infotexts.faction.thumb.description: The Thumb is one of the Five Fingers, the five most powerful Syndicates with enough influence to rival the Wings. Of the Fingers, the Thumb is as known for its class and formality as it is feared for its fanatical devotion to hierarchy. Acting against or even questioning a superior is an offense to be punished with blood, and not even outsiders are exempt from these rules.
infotexts.faction.thumb.shortdescription: Of the Fingers, the Thumb is as known for its class and formality as it is feared for its fanatical devotion to hierarchy.
infotexts.faction.middle.description: The Middle has an extremely tight-knit 'familial' structure, and Syndicate members share close fraternal ties with each other; members of the Middle call each other "Brothers" and "Sisters", and rank in the group is denoted by seniority in the family. The Middle has a completely different attitude towards outsiders. Any slight done to a member of the Middle or its property will be recorded on the "Book of Vengeance" and promptly avenged for, usually within the space of a few days.
infotexts.faction.middle.shortdescription: The Middle has an extremely tight-knit 'familial' structure, and Syndicate members share close fraternal ties with each other. Any slight done to a member of the Middle or its property will be recorded on the "Book of Vengeance" and promptly avenged for, usually within the space of a few days.
infotexts.faction.ring.description: Formal members of the Ring are eccentric artists enamored with the creation of artistic pieces (mostly of the modernist movements), usually related in some way to the human condition. To this end, members exemplify human suffering in their pieces by perpetrating it in highly gruesome and visual manners. Residents of areas under control of the Ring are required to regularly attend "tests" held by the Syndicate and display sufficient artistic aptitude and taste to ensure continued protection from said Syndicate.
infotexts.faction.ring.shortdescription: Formal members of the Ring are eccentric artists enamored with the creation of artistic pieces. To this end, members exemplify human suffering in their pieces by perpetrating it in highly gruesome and visual manners.
infotexts.faction.fixers.description: Fixers are the handymen of Europa, who can be hired for a wide range of contracts, ranging from everyday errands to active combat. Becoming a Fixer requires a license from the Hana Association and from there is free to take on any request so long as they report their performance back to the Association after the job is complete. The majority of Fixers will find themselves working as a part of an Office, a type of business owned and operated by Fixers that is overseen by the Associations. A rare few Fixers operate independently.
infotexts.faction.fixers.shortdescription: Fixers are the handymen of Europa, who can be hired for a wide range of contracts, ranging from everyday errands to active combat.
infotexts.faction.syndicates.description: "Syndicate" is a purposefully vague and broad term that can be used to describe essentially any group of people who work together in an organized, but unregulated, group. Syndicates can do all sorts of activities, and be involved in various types of business, leading to groups with very little in common both being able to be referred to as a Syndicate. Some Syndicates focus on extorting money from people for protection, while others abduct people, kill for fun and pleasure, or do anything in between. They can be small groups that only exist in one corner of the world or large enough to exist in every station. As many Syndicates operate as a business, they have the same rights and obligations as the other businesses such as being able to hold patents on technology and needing to pay taxes.
infotexts.faction.syndicates.shortdescription: Syndicates are a type of organization in the City, and can be seen as the unregulated counterpart to Fixer Offices.
infotexts.faction.wings.description: The Wings, also known as the Wings of the World, are a group of the 26 largest, most powerful conglomerates in the world. They act as the governing bodies of the respective Nests of the City's Districts. Each Wing possesses and utilizes a Singularity, a form of technology that can blatantly violate the laws of physics. Each Wing has its own cultural style and social structure which are reflected in how it governs its Nest, and the policies the Wing sets also determines the way of life in the District's Backstreet. Wings have differing degrees of presence, influence, and benevolence with regards to their Backstreets, although their relationship is ultimately exploitative, even for more cooperative Wings. Security of borders between Nests and Backstreets also vary from plasma walls to mere chain fences, but the Wings' power is such that no one in the Backstreets dares to cross over into a Nest without express permission.
infotexts.faction.wings.shortdescription: The Wings, also known as the Wings of the World, are a group of the 26 largest, most powerful conglomerates in the world. They act as the governing bodies of the respective Nests of the City's Districts.
infotexts.faction.lobotomycorporation.description: Lobotomy Corporation was one of the twenty-six Wings and the owner of District 12's Nest before the corporation's collapse. L Corp.'s Singularity was the ability to materialize the human mind through a formula called Cogito, and the company used this to market itself as an eco-friendly energy producer for the City and the other Wings. Secretly, this was done through the creation and use of Abnormalities, monstrous and highly dangerous entities created from experiments with L Corp.'s Singularity.
infotexts.faction.lobotomycorporation.shortdescrip: Lobotomy Corporation was one of the twenty-six Wings and the owner of District 12's Nest before the corporation's collapse. L Corp.'s Singularity was the ability to materialize the human mind.
infotexts.faction.hongyuan.description: The entirety of District 8 is contained within a single gargantuan building called Hongyuan (Mandarin: 鸿园, lit. The Vast Garden). District 8's Nest lies at the center of the structure, while the Backstreets form the periphery of the building. Different areas of Hongyuan have different taboos imposed upon the residents within. H Corp. manufactures Boluses that contain "essences of treatment" and can transform the body.
infotexts.faction.hongyuan.shortdescription: H Corp. manufactures Boluses that contain "essences of treatment" and can transform the body.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript: Poison the sandwich of the 5th person you see holding a sandwich.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript2: Ask a staff member or senior officer how many ounces of “pilk” are allowed in the establishment.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript3: Upon hearing any word similar to “fish”, express your undying desire to wed a mackerel.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript4: Attempt to sell something that doesn't exist to someone.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript5: Greet every other person you encounter, on the 8th person if they do not respond to your greeting, attempt to convince them they are your long lost relative.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript6: Initiate a game of Never Have I Ever with the first two people you encounter. When one of them 'did not' for the first time, compliment them.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript7: Go to a plant and sniff it three times. If somebody walks by you, shout 'The Bees Knees!' at them.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript8: If someone asks you a question, answer with “Giraffe” and then ask the question to the next person you see.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript9: Play Rock Paper Scissors with the next person you meet, if they use rock, you must ask to pat their head.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript10: Make amends with one of your enemies, Invite them for an apology dinner, then laugh at them and make them pay the bill.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript11: Ask the third person you interact with for their kidneys.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript12: Drink half a glass of alcohol and recount the ABCs backwards.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript13: Engage in conversation with the 9th person you make eye contact with today.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript15: See green from a white wall.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript16: Walk like a crab for 10 minutes.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript17: At the railing on the roof of a building, shout out the name of the person you dislike, then jump off. The height of the building does not matter.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript18: When the next person questions you, hit them once, but don't inflict serious damage. Do not hit them again even if they start attacking you in retaliation.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript19: Maniacally laugh at any mention of your name and afterwards, ask the person to call you the “Jonkler” instead.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript20: Catch a fish in the bathroom toilets.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript21: Convince four people that the bar is giving out free drinks.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript22: Ask the bartender for “bear milk”, if you do not get any, curl up on the floor and imitate sad bear noises.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript23: Lay on the floor without speaking until a staff member speaks to you.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript24: Ask the first non-humanoid entity you encounter how many insects they've eaten in the last day and a half, then scream hysterically for eight seconds if they're confused by the question.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript25: Cause the third person you encounter to have an existential crisis.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript26: Stare at someone for a moment and say "cool thoughts, dude".
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript28: Return to your home this instant. You may leave if there is an animal outside your home.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript29: Do not stop singing everything you say until someone asks you to stop.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript30: Ask the next person you see if they have any soda at home. Do not give them an answer if they ask why.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript31: Start a conspiracy theory, convince 3 people that it's true.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript32: Attempt to convince a staff member to let you into the staff rooms.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript33: Order "Mac n Bees" at the restaurant, over and over until someone gives you something. If what you receive has no bees, mumble something incomprehensible involving your appendix and then leave the restaurant.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript34: Greet 5 people with a unique greeting. Do not greet the same person more than once.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript35: Approach the third person you meet and offer to help them with their current task. If they accept, help them. If they reject you, repeat the request to the next third person you meet.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript36: Go to the nearest bartender and use your best cowboy impression to order water.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript37: Look down and walk ten paces, look up, follow the first person you see and keep making eye contact until they acknowledge you.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript38: Count to 15 and then look for the nearest person, then copy their movements until they ask you what you're doing.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript39: Ask a staff member if you can have a sprayer, if you are given a sprayer, clean every surface you have access to.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript40: Ask a staff member how to invest your savings into raptorcoin.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript41: Ask the 4th person you meet their age. If they are older than you, cough twice and walk away.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript42: Spin a wheel and throw something at the person determined by the result.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript43: Tell a joke to the 5th person you meet if they don’t laugh, tell another until they do.
infotexts.entitydescription.indexprescript44: Cultivate a plant. While cultivating it, initiate any conversation with passerbys by stating 'the mold consumes'. Do not elaborate, and pretend you never said it.
